sentences.en: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.cn: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

sentences.en: A sense of imminent doom was inescapable.
sentences.cn: 一种即将来临的毁灭感无可逃避。

sentences.en: Black clouds, thunder and lightning show that a storm is imminent.
sentences.cn: 乌云 、 雷、电表明一场风暴已迫在眉睫.

sentences.en: Engineering completely new symbiotic relationship is obviously not an imminent possibility.
sentences.cn: 工程上完全新的共生关系显然是可能性不大.

sentences.en: Every one feels that a disaster is imminent, as if a catastrophe is about to come.
sentences.cn: 谁都感到大事不好, 似乎有什么极大的灾难即将来临.

sentences.en: It also provides indication when direct risk is imminent.
sentences.cn: 危险临近时,它也能发出讯号.

sentences.en: Some have said we must not act until the threat is imminent.
sentences.cn: 有人说,我们应该在危险迫近之时再采取行动.

sentences.en: Swept along by the swift current, he was in imminent danger of going over the falls.
sentences.cn: 他被急流冲走, 跌入瀑布的危险已迫在眉睫.

sentences.en: The black clouds show that a storm is imminent.
sentences.cn: 乌云预示暴风雨即将来临.

sentences.en: The country is in imminent danger.
The mere mention of the words "heart failure", can conjure up, to the layman, the prospect of imminent death.
sentences.cn: 一提“心脏衰竭”四字，外行人就联想到命不久矣的情景。

sentences.en: They ( ships ) were in imminent danger of being wrecked and were separated.
sentences.cn: 它们 ( 这些船 ) 各奔东西,随时都有倾覆的危险.

sentences.en: They warned that an attack is imminent.
sentences.cn: 他们警告袭击即将发生。

sentences.en: They were advising clients to hedge the imminent inflation by buying farmland.
sentences.cn: 他们曾建议顾客们购买农田,以免遭受迫在眉捷的通货膨胀带来的损失.

sentences.en: Yet the imminent crisis in its balance of payments may be the President's nemesis.
sentences.cn: 不过迫近的国际收支平衡危机也许是对总统的报应。

words.tran_cn: 迫切；急迫，危急；迫近的危险或祸患

phrases.tran_cn: 紧迫的威胁；逼近的威胁

trans.tran_cn: （通常指不愉快的事）即将发生的，迫切的，危急的，逼近的，迫在眉睫
trans.tran_en: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon
